newsitem.title: USA: Netscape says N.America Q1 deal size rises.
newsitem.headline: Netscape says N.America Q1 deal size rises.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp Chief Financial Officer Peter Currie said the median deal size in North America in the first quarter doubled from average levels in the second half of 1996.

Currie also said deferred revenues -- the amount of revenues booked in a quarter but not recognised until a later period -- had risen substantially to $13 million in the first quarter, well above its levels in prior quarters.
Netscape executives said the order sizes was a sign the company's focus on selling to larger businesses is succeeding.
"We are doing larger ticket sizes, which is consistent with an enterprise sale," Currie told reporters in a conference call after the company reported first quarter results.
Daniel Rimer, an analyst at Hambrecht & Quist, said total deferred revenue had increased from $80.3 million at the end of 1996 to $93 million at the end of March.
Software companies such as Netscape, which sell their products partly on an annual licensing basis, often defer revenues to be recognized in later quarters.
